item.title: Lessons From The Stars: How To Live On A Climate-Changed World
item.description: September 13, 2017 - Classification of planets offers a way to see how Anthropocenes — and a successful route through them — might be part of a continuum of planetary evolution, says astrophysicist Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - Classification of planets offers a way to see how Anthropocenes — and a successful route through them — might be part of a continuum of planetary evolution, says astrophysicist Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/09/13/550672867/lessons-from-the-stars-how-to-live-on-a-climate-changed-world

item.title: How The Minimum Wage Affects Restaurant Hygiene
item.description: September 13, 2017 - An analysis of Seattle restaurants shows that as the city dramatically raised the minimum wage for restaurant employees and other workers, restaurants responded by lowering hygiene standards.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - An analysis of Seattle restaurants shows that as the city dramatically raised the minimum wage for restaurant employees and other workers, restaurants responded by lowering hygiene standards. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/13/550607377/how-the-minimum-wage-affects-restaurant-hygiene

item.title: With Power Out, Many Florida Gas Stations Remain Closed
item.description: September 12, 2017 - A lot of people evacuated from Florida in anticipation of Hurricane Irma. Now they desperately want to come home, but the lack of fuel is making that tough.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - A lot of people evacuated from Florida in anticipation of Hurricane Irma. Now they desperately want to come home, but the lack of fuel is making that tough. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/12/550464023/with-power-out-many-florida-gas-stations-remain-closed

item.title: Pet Store Puppies Linked To Campylobacter Outbreak In People
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Adorable fuzzy puppies aren't usually thought of as disease vectors. But they come with germs, too. It's not clear how pet store puppies caused dozens of humans to get sick with Campylobacter.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Adorable fuzzy puppies aren't usually thought of as disease vectors. But they come with germs, too. It's not clear how pet store puppies caused dozens of humans to get sick with Campylobacter. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/12/550423656/pet-store-puppies-linked-to-campylobacter-outbreak-in-people

item.title: Hurricane Irma Blasts Into The Record Books With Lasting Intensity
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Hurricane Irma was the longest-lasting powerful hurricane or typhoon ever recorded, worldwide. It kept 185-mph winds for 37 hours — longer than any storm on record.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Hurricane Irma was the longest-lasting powerful hurricane or typhoon ever recorded, worldwide. It kept 185-mph winds for 37 hours — longer than any storm on record. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/12/550188154/hurricane-irma-blasts-into-the-record-books-with-lasting-intensity

item.title: Is One Drink OK For Pregnant Women? Around The Globe, The Answer Is No
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Researchers set out to answer this question: Is there a safe level of alcohol consumption during pregnancy? Turns out, that's a hard question to answer. The advice remains: Don't risk it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Researchers set out to answer this question: Is there a safe level of alcohol consumption during pregnancy? Turns out, that's a hard question to answer. The advice remains: Don't risk it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/12/550152771/is-one-drink-ok-for-pregnant-women-around-the-globe-the-answer-is-no

item.title: Why We Can't Shake Life's 'Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda' Moments
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Amy Summerville runs the Regret Lab at Miami University in Ohio. She says regret is pervasive — but it doesn't always have to be a negative emotion.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Amy Summerville runs the Regret Lab at Miami University in Ohio. She says regret is pervasive — but it doesn't always have to be a negative emotion. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/11/550260750/why-we-can-t-shake-life-s-coulda-woulda-shoulda-moments

item.title: Coffee, Bees and Climate Change Are Linked In Ways You May Not Have Expected
item.description: September 11, 2017 - A new study projects that by 2050, climate change could reduce the amount of ground usable to grow coffee in Latin America by up to 88 percent. Bees play a key role in increasing coffee yields.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - A new study projects that by 2050, climate change could reduce the amount of ground usable to grow coffee in Latin America by up to 88 percent. Bees play a key role in increasing coffee yields. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/11/550169720/coffee-bees-and-climate-change-are-linked-in-ways-you-may-not-have-expected

item.title: Manatees Rescued After Irma Leaves Them High And Dry In Sarasota Bay
item.description: September 11, 2017 - When the approaching storm sucked the water out of the shallow bay in Florida, it left a pair of manatees stuck on the bottom. Good Samaritans and Manatee County sheriff's deputies helped out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - When the approaching storm sucked the water out of the shallow bay in Florida, it left a pair of manatees stuck on the bottom. Good Samaritans and Manatee County sheriff's deputies helped out. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/11/550164459/manatees-rescued-after-irma-leaves-them-high-and-dry-in-sarasota-bay

item.title: R&D Costs For Cancer Drugs Are Likely Much Less Than Industry Claims, Study Finds
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Industry says it costs about $2.7 billion to bring a cancer drug to market. But oncologists who ran the numbers put the average closer to $650 million. Drugs are priced way too high, the doctors say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Industry says it costs about $2.7 billion to bring a cancer drug to market. But oncologists who ran the numbers put the average closer to $650 million. Drugs are priced way too high, the doctors say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/11/550135932/r-d-costs-for-cancer-drugs-are-likely-much-less-than-industry-claims-study-finds

item.title: Cassini Spacecraft Prepares For A Fiery Farewell In Saturn's Atmosphere
item.description: September 11, 2017 - NASA's probe has spent the past 13 years orbiting Saturn, making a number of important discoveries along the way. On Friday, it will hurl itself into the planet's atmosphere and disintegrate.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - NASA's probe has spent the past 13 years orbiting Saturn, making a number of important discoveries along the way. On Friday, it will hurl itself into the planet's atmosphere and disintegrate. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/08/549448180/cassini-spacecraft-prepares-for-a-fiery-farewell-in-saturns-atmosphere

item.title: Yes, Some Questions Are Better Than Others
item.description: September 11, 2017 - In the child's world of Twenty Questions, it's pretty easy to evaluate what makes a good question. But producing good questions in the real world can be a more complicated affair, says Tania Lombrozo.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - In the child's world of Twenty Questions, it's pretty easy to evaluate what makes a good question. But producing good questions in the real world can be a more complicated affair, says Tania Lombrozo. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/09/11/550151190/yes-some-questions-are-better-than-others

item.title: Is All That Wildfire Smoke Damaging My Lungs?
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Forest fires have brought a smoky haze to the West, along with stinging eyes, sore throats and headaches to people far from flames. Unseen particles of ash also make it hard for some to breathe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Forest fires have brought a smoky haze to the West, along with stinging eyes, sore throats and headaches to people far from flames. Unseen particles of ash also make it hard for some to breathe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/11/549165837/is-all-that-wildfire-smoke-damaging-my-lungs

item.title: So Your Kitchen Sponge Is A Bacteria Hotbed. Here's What To Do
item.description: September 11, 2017 - For the first time, scientists have carefully analyzed all the critters in a kitchen sponge. There turns out to be a huge number. Despite recent news reports, there is something you can do about it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - For the first time, scientists have carefully analyzed all the critters in a kitchen sponge. There turns out to be a huge number. Despite recent news reports, there is something you can do about it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/11/548926054/can-you-really-not-clean-your-kitchen-sponge

item.title: Riding Out Irma On Florida's Space Coast — And Keeping An Eye On The Spacecraft
item.description: September 10, 2017 - At the Kennedy Space Center, riding out a hurricane means something a little different. You have to keep the Orion Multi-Purpose Crew Vehicle capsule happy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 10, 2017 - At the Kennedy Space Center, riding out a hurricane means something a little different. You have to keep the Orion Multi-Purpose Crew Vehicle capsule happy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/10/550003276/riding-out-irma-on-floridas-space-coast-and-keeping-on-eye-on-the-spacecraft
